application_type_full: Outline planning permission: All matters reserved
description: Outline planning permission with the details of access, appearance, landscaping, layout and scale reserved for later determination. A demolition phase and phased redevelopment (each phase being an independent act of development) comprising data centre use (B8) of up to 46,750 sqm GEA, including ancillary offices, internal plant and equipment (including flues), and substation. In addition to the above the Development will include car parking; provision of external plant and equipment (including flues); creation of servicing areas and provision of associated services, including waste, refuse, cycle storage, and lighting; and for the laying out of the buildings; routes and open spaces within the development; and all associated works and operations including but not limited to: demolition; earthworks; provision of attenuation infrastructure, engineering operations. Development shall be in accordance with the approved Development Parameters Schedule and Plans.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The first application for approval of reserved matters shall be made to the local planning authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission. All subsequent reserved matters applications shall be submitted no later than five years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To accord with the provisions of Section 92 (2) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - Time Limit - Implementation

The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the first of the reserved matters to be approved.

The relevant parcel(s), defined as north of Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel A) and south of Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel B) must be begun no later than the expiration of two (2) years from the final approval of the final Reserved Matters application for the relevant parcel (or part therein in the event of Reserved Matters applications which include parts of both parcels).

Reason: To comply with the provision of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 3 - In accordance with approved plans and documents

The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans and documents submitted (see drawing numbers at the top of this decision) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority.

All Reserved Matters applications will need to confirm compliance with the approved plans and documents, or compliance with any minor modification which may be first agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the outline planning permission.

Condition : 4 - Site Wide Phasing Plan

No development above ground level shall take place until a programme of phasing for the implementation of the whole development has been agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority and takes into account the timescales set out in Condition 1 (Time Limit � Submission of Reserved Matters). The development shall thereafter be implemented in compliance with the approved phasing and implementation plan. Any amendment to the phasing and implementation programme shall be subject to obtaining prior written approval from the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure satisfactory comprehensive development and proper planning of the area.

Condition : 6 - Scheme Parameters � Compliance with Development Parameters Schedule and Plans

The submission of all reserved matters and the implementation of the development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following plans and documents unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Authority:

� Revised Outline Planning Application Booklet (November 2023) including Parameter Plans: 0517-A03-142 Rev PL01 and 0517-A03-132 Rev PL03;

� Design Code Data Centre Campus � Design Code (rev P12) [dated July 2022].

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning and to define the scope of this permission.

Condition : 7 - Restrict Use to Data Centre with ancillary Offices (and no other Class B8 and Class E Uses)

The development shall not be used for any purposes other than as a Data Centre with ancillary offices, and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Use Class B8 or Use Class E of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended), or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).

Reason: The Council is satisfied that the use hereby permitted would not result in detriment to adjoining premises but would wish to control the operations of the site and future changes of use within the same Use Class, in the interests of highway safety and to protect nearby land uses and the character of the area.

Condition : 8 - Land Use (maximum permitted Data Centre (Class B8) floorspace including ancillary offices

The maximum permitted floorspace (gross external area in square metres) for each use granted by this permission shall be:

� Data Centre (Use Class B8) - 46,750 sq. m (including ancillary offices (Use Class E(g)(i), internal plant, and equipment (including flues), and substation).

Reason: To ensure that the development is carried out in accordance with the approved plans and other submitted details and to ensure that the quantum of floorspace keeps within the parameters assessed pursuant to the Revised Outline Planning Application Booklet: Development Parameters (Schedule and Plans), Design Code and Illustrative Landscape Plan and Landscape Masterplan in relation to the development, that the Council may be satisfied as to the details of the development in the interests of the visual amenity of the area.

Condition : 9 - Design Code

All applications for Reserved Matters approval shall be accompanied by a Design Statement which shall explain (demonstrate) how the submissions (proposal) conforms to the requirements of the approved Design Code (reference: Data Centre Campus � Design Code (rev P12) [dated July 2022] or any subsequent version agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, to accord with the terms of the application and to provide an appropriate design, appearance, scale and form of development in the interests of the visual amenity and character of the area.

Condition : 10 - Materials (Details)

Except for any works relating to site clearance, remediation, piling and/or substructure, the relevant phase (or part therein) of the development hereby approved shall not commence until details (including sample panels where appropriate) of the materials to be used for the external surfaces for each of the buildings and hard-surfaced areas within the relevant phase (or part therein) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications to these matters which have been given in this application.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that all built development would be of a high-quality design standard and in order that the Council may be satisfied as to the details of the development in the interests of the appearance and visual amenity of the area.

Condition : 11 - Heat Networking Safeguarding

Prior to the commencement of any phase of the development, evidence should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has made sufficient provisions to enable the connection to a feasible district heating network in the future including a safeguarded pipe route for future connection at the site boundary, provision of a dedicated internal space within the development for a heat exchanger assembly (subject to a separate planning permission, as necessary) that is sized for the maximum waste heat capacity from the cooling plant, selection of a cooling system which enables waste heat to be recovered from a single heat exchanger.

The approved building(s) shall be constructed and completed in accordance with the agreed details.

Reason: To ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.

Condition : 12 - Drainage design

Prior to commencement of any phase of the development hereby permitted a final detailed drainage design including drawings and supporting calculations and updated Drainage Assessment Form shall have been submitted to the Lead Local Flood Authority for review and approval, aligned with the Surface Water Drainage Technical Note (13/12/2023) and associated drawings related to that phase. The applicant should provide the results of the infiltration testing, and should permeable areas be unable to infiltrate at a suitable rate, additional attenuation storage should be considered to account for the required attenuation storage volume. The half drain time of the storage features should be less than 24 hours.

A detailed management plan confirming routine maintenance tasks for all drainage components within any given phase must also be submitted to demonstrate how the drainage system is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In order to prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site.

Condition : 13 - Built in accordance with drainage details

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for that phase has been completed in accordance with the details approved under Condition 12. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan(s) for all of the proposed drainage components.

Reason: In order to ensure that the methods to mitigate the risk of surface water flooding have been implemented as agreed and that the drainage system is suitably managed.

Condition : 14 - SuDS Infiltration

No drainage systems for infiltration of surface water to the ground are permitted other than with the written consent of the Local Planning Authority. Any proposals for such systems must be supported by an assessment of the risks to controlled waters. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, as applicable.

Reasons: To ensure that the development does not contribute to, and is not put at unacceptable risk from or adversely affected by, unacceptable levels of water pollution caused by mobilised contaminants. This is in line with paragraph 187 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

Condition : 15 - All Non-road Mobile Machinery (NRMM)

All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of between 37kW and 560kW (inclusive) used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development hereby approved shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance (SPG) 'Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition' dated July 2014, or subsequent replacement guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.

The development shall also demonstrate that the proposed development is compliant with Building Emissions Benchmark (BEBs), specified in the GLA's Supplementary Planning Guidance "Sustainable Design and Construction" dated April 2014).

Reason: To minimise air pollution In the interests of air quality and the wider local environment.

Condition : 17 - Ecology (Watching Brief)

Prior to the commencement of the development for any given phase, a watching brief for bats/and nesting birds related to that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details.

The watching brief shall include:

� Details of the pre-development check (no more than a week prior to the beginning).

� Details of the toolbox talk with anyone involved with the construction of development to make them aware of the potential presence of the bats/and or nesting birds and what to do in event of finding any.

� Careful working procedures-to be defined in the statement.

� Details of who will be watching the construction and what qualifications they hold.

� A contingency plan of what to do in case of finding a bat roost and/or bird's nest.

Reason: In the interests of nature conservation.

Condition : 18 - Ecology (Retained Trees)

Notwithstanding any details in the submitted plans, no development shall commence within the relevant phase (or part therein), until a scheme for the protection of the retained trees within that phase, in accordance with BS5837:2012 has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall include:

a) A plan to a scale and level of accuracy appropriate to the proposal that shows the position, crown spread and Root Protection Area of every tree on site in relation to the approved plans and particulars. The positions of all trees to be removed shall be indicated on this plan.

b) A schedule of tree works for all the retained trees, specifying pruning and other remedial or preventative work, whether for physiological, hazard abatement, aesthetic, or operational reasons.

c) All the tree work shall be carried out in accordance with BS 3998:2010 (Tree Work � Recommendations).

d) The details and positions (shown on plan at paragraph (a) above) of the Tree Protection Barriers, identified separately where required for different phases of construction work. The Tree Protection Barriers must be erected prior to each phase of construction commencing and remain in place, and undamaged for the duration of that phase. No works shall take place on the next phase until the Tree Protection Barriers are repositioned for that phase.

e) The details and positions of any underground service runs shall be shown on the plan required at paragraph (a). The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree or hedge shall be carried out in complete accordance with BS5837:2012, before any equipment, machinery, or materials are brought onto the site for the purposes of development or other operations. The fencing shall be retained intact for the full duration of the development until all equipment, materials and surplus materials have been removed from the site. If the fencing is damaged all operations shall

Condition : 19 - Ecology (Ecological Management Plan)

Prior to above ground works in any given phase, an Ecological Management Plan related to that phase shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to incorporate measures that include:

i) Details of ecological enhancement (a Biodiversity Enhancement Strategy) and urban greening factor (which is not touched upon in the Ecological Impact Assessment Report) including how the urban greening factor is to be delivered and achieved on site; and

ii) Details of how the enhancement measures will be monitored, management responsibilities and maintenance schedules.

The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In the interests of nature conservation and to promote biodiversity and ecological enhancements.

Condition : 20 - Ecology (Biodiversity Net Gain)

Prior to commencement of any phase of the development hereby permitted, a Biodiversity Net Gain report with Excel Metric calculation for that phase provided in excel format shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In order to promote biodiversity and ecological enhancements.

Condition : 21 - Ecology (Habitat Management Plan)

Prior to commencement of any phase of the development hereby permitted, a habitat management plan for that phase with respect to the eradication of invasive species Cotoneaster (Schedule 9, WCA, 1981 (as amended) shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In order to promote biodiversity and ecological enhancements.

Condition : 23 - Construction Management Strategy (CMS)

No development shall take place at any given phase until a detailed Construction Management Strategy (CMS), covering the application site and any adjoining land which will be used during the construction period, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that given phase. The CMS shall include:

� Details of cranes and other tall construction equipment (including the details of obstacle lighting) � such schemes shall comply with Advice Note 4 'Cranes' (available at http://www.aoa.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Advice-Note-4-Cranes-2016.pdf) or any updated version.

The approved strategy (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority) shall be implemented for the duration of the construction period for that given phase.

Reason: To ensure that construction work and construction equipment on the site and adjoining land does not conflict with Instrument Flight Procedures serving Heathrow Airport, including through interference with communication, navigational aids and surveillance equipment or endanger aircraft movement and the safe operation of the aerodrome.

Condition : 24 - Remediation Strategy

No development shall take place at any given phase until a remediation strategy to deal with the risks associated with contamination of the site as identified in the Phase 1 Desk Study (February 2023), in respect of the development hereby permitted, has been submitted to, and approved in writing, by the Local Planning Authority for that given phase. This strategy shall include the following components:

1. A site investigation scheme, based on the Phase 1 Desk Study (February 2023) to provide information for a detailed assessment of the risk to all receptors that may be affected, including those off-site.

2. The results of the site investigation and the detailed risk assessment referred to in (1) and, based on these, an options appraisal and remediation strategy giving full details of the remediation measures required and how they are to be undertaken.

3. A verification report providing details of the data that will be collected in order to demonstrate that the works set out in the remediation strategy in (2) are complete and identifying any requirements for longer-term monitoring of pollutant linkages, sampling and monitoring, maintenance, and arrangements for contingency action.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved strategy (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority).

Reason: To ensure that the development does not contribute to, and is not put at, unacceptable risk from adversely affected unacceptable levels of water pollution in line with paragraphs 187, 196, and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

Condition : 25 - Unexpected Contamination

During any phase of the development hereby permitted:

a. The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if contamination not previously identified is found to be present at the site. No further development (unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority) shall be carried out until appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that phase of development continues.

b. Soils or other landscaping materials imported to the site (if applicable) should be demonstrated to be safe for use in accordance with a scheme of verification and testing to be agreed with the local authority.

Before any phase of the development is first brought into use:

c. The agreed scheme for decontamination (if applicable) referred to in clause a) and b) above, including any amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not contribute to and is not put at unacceptable risk from, or adversely affected by, unacceptable levels of water pollution from previously unidentified contamination sources at the development site. This is in line with paragraphs 187, 196 and 197 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

Condition : 26 - Investigate Boreholes

Prior to commencement of any phase of the development hereby permitted, a scheme for managing any borehole installed for the investigation of soils, groundwater or geotechnical purposes shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall provide details of how redundant boreholes are to be decommissioned and how any borehole that need to be retained, post-development, for monitoring purposed will be secured, protected, and inspected.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved investigation (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority).

Reasons: To ensure that redundant boreholes are safe and secure, and do not cause groundwater pollution in line with paragraph 187 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

Condition : 27 - Monitoring

No development shall take place for any given phase until a monitoring and maintenance plan in respect of contamination, including a timetable of monitoring and submission of reports have been submitted to, and approved in writing, by the Local Planning Authority for that given phase.

Reports as specified in the approved plan, including details of any necessary contingency action arising from the monitoring, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the site does not pose any further risk to the water environment by managing any ongoing contamination issues and completing all necessary long-term remediation measures, this is in line with paragraph 187 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

Condition : 28 - Piling

No development shall take place in any given phase until a Piling Method Statement (detailing the depth and type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling will be carried out, including measures to prevent and minimise the potential for damage to subsurface sewerage infrastructure, groundwater resources, and the programme of works) has been submitted to, and approved in writing, by the Local Planning Authority for any given phase.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Piling Method Statement (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority). Piling using penetrative methods shall not be carried out other than with the written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not harm groundwater resources in line with the Environment Agency's approach to groundwater protection.

Condition : 29 - Radar Mitigation Scheme (Air Traffic Safety)

1. No development shall take place in any given phase, unless there has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and by the Radar Operator � NATS (En-route) Plc, for that given phase, either:

a) Detailed plans or evidence for the proposed buildings in that individual phase, demonstrating that there would be no detrimental impact upon the operation of the Hounslow H10 SSR Radar; or

b) Details of a 'Radar Mitigation Scheme' (including a timetable for its implementation during construction) to mitigate any detrimental impact upon the Heathrow H10 SSR Radar.

2. Where a 'Radar Mitigation Scheme' has been required, no construction above 15m above ground level shall take place on site, unless the 'Radar Mitigation Scheme' has been implemented.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and NATS (En-route) Plc).

Reason: In the interests of Air Traffic Safety and of the operations of NATS En-route Plc.

Supporting notes:

"Operator" means NATS (En Route) plc, incorporated under the Companies Act (4129273) whose registered office is 4000 Parkway, Whiteley, Fareham, Hants PO15 7FL or such other organisation licensed from time to time under sections 5 and 6 of the Transport Act 2000 to provide air traffic services to the relevant managed area (within the meaning of section 40 of that Act).

"Detailed plans or evidence demonstrating no impact" means provision of further, acceptable information demonstrating that existing or consented neighbouring schemes will provide shielding of the proposal towards the H10 SSR, reducing the potential for signal reflections.

"Radar Mitigation Scheme" or "Scheme" means a detailed scheme agreed with the Operator which sets out the measures to be taken to avoid at all times the impact of the development on the H10 Primary and Secondary Surveillance rada

Condition : 30 - Crane Operation Plan (Air Traffic Safety)

No development shall take place at any given phase until, a Crane Operation Plan, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with the Radar Operator for that given phase. The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Crane Operation Plan (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and NATS (En-route) Plc).

Reason: In the interests of Air Traffic Safety and of the operations of NATS En-route Plc.

Supporting notes:

"Operator" means NATS (En Route) plc, incorporated under the Companies Act (4129273) whose registered office is 4000 Parkway, Whiteley, Fareham, Hants PO15 7FL or such other organisation licensed from time to time under sections 5 and 6 of the Transport Act 2000 to provide air traffic services to the relevant managed area (within the meaning of section 40 of that Act).

"Crane Operation Plan (COP)" means a detailed plan agreed with the Operator which defines the type of crane and the timing and duration of all crane works to be carried out at the site in order to manage and mitigate at all times the impact of the development on the H10 Primary and Secondary Surveillance Radar systems at Heathrow Airport and associated air traffic management operations of the Operator.

Condition : 31 - Bird Hazard Management Plan

No development above ground level shall take place in any given phase until a Bird Hazard Management Plan has been submitted to, and approved in writing, by the Local Planning Authority for that given phase. The plan shall include details of:

(i) Management of any flat/shallow pitched/green roofs on buildings within the site which may be attractive to nesting, roosting and "loafing" birds.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Bird Hazard Management Plan (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority) and shall remain in force for the life of the building(s).

Reason: It is necessary to manage the flat roofs to minimise its attractiveness to birds which could endanger the safe movement of aircraft and the operation of Heathrow Airport.

Condition : 32 - Secure by Design

The development shall achieve 'Secured by Design' accreditation awarded by the Design-Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (APCO).

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase until accreditation has been achieved and evidence of such accreditation has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for that given phase.

Reason: In pursuance of the Council's duty under section 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 to consider crime and disorder implications in excising its planning functions; to promote the well-being of the area in pursuance of the Council's powers under section 2 of the Local Government Act 2000 and to ensure the development provides a safe and secure environment in accordance with Policy CC2 of the Local Plan and Policy D11 of the London Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

Condition : 33 - Demolition or Construction Hours

No demolition or construction work shall take place in any given phase except between the hours of 8am and 6pm on Mondays to Fridays and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior written agreement of the Local Planning Authority for that given phase.

Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the locality.

Condition : 34 - External Lighting

No development shall take place at any given phase until, full details of an external lighting scheme has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that given phase. The external lighting scheme shall include:

(i) Details such as the appearance and technical details/specifications, orientation, location, height, type and direction of light sources and intensity of illumination and measures to reduce light spill into any nearby residential properties and neighbouring commercial units.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved external lighting scheme (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority) and shall be maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In order to protect against intrusive forms of lighting.

Condition : 35 - Delivery and servicing plan

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase until, a Delivery & Servicing Plan (including details of vehicle access and egress arrangements and times that servicing shall take place) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that given phase. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by TfL and include measures required to ensure sufficient arrangements (physical as well as managerial) for the servicing, including refuse collection, of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved delivery and servicing plan (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority) and shall be maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In the interests of the safety of pedestrians and vehicles and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 36 - Car Parking / Blue Badge / ECVP

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase until, details of on-site car parking, including provision for dedicated blue badge parking, and electric vehicle charging points (EVCP) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase.

The car parking, blue badge car parking spaces and EVCP shall be implemented and made available for use in full accordance with the approved details before any phase of the development is brought into use.

The car parking spaces, including blue badge car parking spaces, shall be retained thereafter and managed in accordance with the details approved Under Condition 37 (CPMP). The EVCP shall be maintained in full working order.

Reason: In order to control the level and usage of parking on the site and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 38 - Cycle storage facilities and pedestrian gates

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase until:

1. Full details (including the number, location, the design (plans, elevations and sections) of secure structures and manufacturer's specifications) of all cycle stands for the employees of, and visitors to, the development (including any additional infrastructure such as repair/maintenance stands and equipment) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase.

2. Details of shower/changing facilities including drying rooms, lockers and details of the design of the pedestrian gates at each vehicular access to the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase. The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved shower/changing facilities and pedestrian gates at each vehicular access to the site shall accommodate cyclists before the relevant building(s) for that phase is occupied (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority) and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 39 - Construction Noise Limits

Based upon guidance contained within BS 5228:2009 + A1:2014: Noise, Noise levels from construction works at nearby existing residential receptors shall not exceed the following construction noise criteria:

Daytime works will not exceed 75 dB LAeq, T at the worst-affected residential property during the following time periods without prior agreement with the Local Authority:

� Monday to Friday (08:00 - 8:00 hours)
� Saturday (08:00 to 13:00 hours)

Works outside of the standard hours will be subject to prior agreement and prior notice will be provided to the London Borough of Hounslow.

Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living and working conditions.

Condition : 41 - Circular Economy (reserved matters)

Each application for reserved matters shall be accompanied by a detailed Circular Economy Statement in line with the GLA's Circular Economy Statement Guidance, which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The statement shall adhere to the principles set out in the draft Circular Economy Statement.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason: In the interests of sustainable waste management and in order to maximise the re-use of materials.

Condition : 42 - Circular Economy (reserved matters - post construction monitoring report)

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase until, a post-construction monitoring report has been completed in line with the Greater London Authority's (GLA) Circular Economy Statement Guidance published at the time of submission.

The post-construction monitoring report shall be submitted to the GLA for approval, via email at: circulareconomystatements@london.gov.uk, along with any supporting evidence as per the guidance. Confirmation of submission to the GLA shall be submitted to the local planning authority simultaneously together with a copy of the documents submitted.

Reason: In the interests of sustainable development and to maximise on-site carbon dioxide saving.

Condition : 43 - Tree Planting

(a) No development (except for demolition, site clearance, ground investigation and remediation) shall take place in any given phase until a full specification of all proposed tree planting has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase. The specification shall include the quantity, size, species, and positions or density of all trees to be planted, how they will be planted and protected and the proposed times of planting.

(b) All trees shall be planted in accordance with the details and times stated in the approved specification and in accordance with British Standard 8545:2014 (or an equivalent British Standard if replaced).

(c) Any trees that, within five years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the local planning authority) seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced with another tree of a similar size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction.

Reason: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site and the area and to promote biodiversity.

Condition : 44 - Landscape Management

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase until, a landscape management plan, including long term design objectives, management responsibilities and maintenance schedules for all landscape areas including all proposed trees, shrub and hedgerows over a minimum period of 5 years from the implementation the final planting scheme, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved landscape management plan (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority) and shall be maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In the interests of the proper maintenance of the site and in order to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site, the character of the locality and to promote biodiversity.

Condition : 45 - External Equipment

No development (except for demolition, site clearance, ground investigation and remediation) shall take place in any given phase until, full details of any external equipment to be installed within the site and on the building(s) including louvres, flues, window cleaning equipment and mechanical plant shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase.

The installation of external equipment shall not be commenced until the details have been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The equipment shall only be installed in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In order that the Council may be satisfied as to the details of the development and in the interests of air quality and the appearance and visual amenity of the area.

Condition : 46 - Fixed Plant Noise

Prior to the installation of any fixed plant, a technical report covering details of fixed plant, including any noise mitigation and predicted noise levels at any sensitive receptor, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The assessment shall be submitted following the calculation methodology under BS 8233:2014 and BS 4142 + A1:2019 and as referenced within the Noise and Vibration Impact Assessment [ref: 19090-HYD-XX-XX-RP-AC-1001], dated 24 February 2023.

Fixed plant shall thereafter only be installed and used in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such for all times thereafter.

Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of local residents', adjoining businesses and the amenities of the locality.

Condition : 47 - Air Quality (HDV movements)

No development shall take place at any given phase until a detailed air quality assessment of the maximum HDV movements associated with the construction phase of the development has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase. The surrounding sensitive receptors along the expected routes are to be included within the assessment.

Reason: To ensure that surrounding sensitive receptors will not be exposed to a significant increase in poor air quality.

Condition : 48 - Diesel generators

Prior to the installation of any diesel generator in any given phase, a Diesel Generator Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase. The Diesel Generator Strategy shall include:

(i) A commitment that the diesel generators shall only operate in the event of a power outage to maintain critical operations of the facility or for necessary maintenance and testing;

(ii) Monitoring and management arrangements of the diesel generators; and

(iii) A mitigation strategy in the event that the generators are required to be used for over 50 hours per year.

The diesel generators shall only be used in accordance with the approved Diesel Generator Strategy.

Reason: In the interests of air quality and to protect neighbours' living conditions and the wider local environment.

Condition : 49 - Commercial Waste and Recycling

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase until, full details of the waste and recycling facilities, including management of storage areas, internal collection and collection from the site, has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority for that phase.

All refuse and recycling bins and delivery carts in association with the approved development are to be stored within their enclosures at all times and only brought out when deliveries are being made or refuse collected.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved waste and recycling facilities (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority) and thereafter retained as such for the lifetime of the development, at all times without obstruction.

Reason: To protect the quality of the local environment and to prevent obstruction and inconvenience to users of the development.

Condition : 50 - Whole Life-Cycle Carbon

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase before the post-construction tab of the Greater London Authority's (GLA) Whole Life-Cycle Carbon Assessment template is completed in line with the GLA's Whole Life-Cycle Carbon Assessment Guidance published at the time of submission. The post-construction assessment shall be submitted to the GLA for approval at: ZeroCarbonPlanning@london.gov.uk, along with any supporting evidence as per the guidance. Confirmation of submission to the GLA shall be submitted to the local planning authority for that phase, simultaneously together with a copy of the documents submitted, prior to occupation of the development.

Reason: In the interests of sustainable development and to maximise on-site carbon dioxide savings.

Condition : 51 - Energy and sustainability (Detailed Energy Assessment)

(a) No development shall take place in any given phase until, a detailed energy assessment (demonstrating how the targets for carbon dioxide emissions reduction are to be met in line with the Mayor's energy hierarchy) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and by the GLA for that given phase.

(b) Prior to commencement of any given phase, full Design Stage calculations under the [Standard Assessment Procedure/National Calculation Method] shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and by the GLA for that phase, to show that the development will be constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, or any subsequent approved revisions, and achieved a 35 per cent site-wide reduction in non-domestic emissions (including a 15 per cent reduction at Be Lean stage). The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority).

(c) Upon final commencement of operation of any low and zero carbon technologies, suitable devices for the monitoring of the low and zero carbon technologies shall have been installed, and the monitored data shall be submitted automatically to a monitoring web-platform at daily intervals for a period of three years from the point of full operation. The data shall be made available to the local planning authority on request for a period of five years.

Reason: In order to ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.

Condition : 52 - Energy and sustainability (BREEAM) for DC Building 01

(a) Within ten months of the construction phase of development for Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel A) starting on site, a BREEAM Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority for that phase to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved.

(b) Within ten months of the building(s) hereby permitted being first occupied or brought into use for Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel A), a BREEAM Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority for that phase to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.

(c) Within three months of the construction phase of development for Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel A) starting on site evidence shall be provided that a submission has been made to BRE for BREEAM Design Stage certification targeting the above score.

(d) Within six months of the building(s) hereby permitted being first occupied or brought into use for Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel A), evidence shall be provided that a submission has been made to BRE for BREEAM As-Built certification targeting the above score.

Reason: In order to ensure the highest standard of sustainable design and construction.

Supporting notes:

a. Details submitted should state if BREEAM will be fully fitted, shell and core or shell only. Additional BREEAM Refurbishment and Fit-Out details will likely be required where not specified as fully fitted.

Condition : 53 - Energy and sustainability (BREEAM) for DC Building 02

Within ten months of the construction phase of development for South of Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel B) starting on site, a BREEAM Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority for that phase to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved.

A. Within ten months of the building(s) hereby permitted being first occupied or brought into use for South of Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel B), a BREEAM Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority for that phase to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.

B. Within three months of the construction phase of development for South of Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel B) starting on site evidence shall be provided that a submission has been made to BRE for BREEAM Design Stage certification targeting the above score.

C. Within six months of the building(s) hereby permitted being first occupied or brought into use for South of Plane Tree Crescent (Parcel B), evidence shall be provided that a submission has been made to BRE for BREEAM As-Built certification targeting the above score.

Supporting notes:

Condition : 54 - Water Efficiency

The development shall ensure that mains water consumption achieves at least the BREEAM 'Excellent' standard for the 'Wat 01' water category or equivalent.

The development shall be maintained in accordance with the approved details at all times thereafter for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In order to protect and conserve water supplies and resources.

Condition : 55 - Energy and sustainability (Sustainable materials)

(a) Prior to above ground works in any given phase, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for that phase that demonstrate:

(i) At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.

(ii) At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.

(iii) No construction or insulation materials are to be used which would release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

(b) No building hereby permitted shall be occupied in any given phase until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the local planning authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved details under Part (a) of this condition.

The development shall be maintained in accordance with the approved details at all times thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of sustainable development and in order to ensure the sustainable sourcing of materials.

Condition : 56 - Energy and sustainability (PVs)

Prior to above ground works in any given phase, details of the specifications (regarding power), number, appearance, location, orientation, total area and predicted carbon savings from the photovoltaic panels shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for that phase.

The details shall show how the renewable energy carbon savings are to be achieved and maximized. The photovoltaic panels shall be installed in accordance with the approved details prior to the occupation of any building of the relevant phase of the development and retained and maintained as such unless otherwise agreed by the local planning authority.

Reason: In order to ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.

Condition : 57 - Energy and sustainability (ASHPs)

Prior to above ground works in any given phase, full details of the proposed centralised heat pumps shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These shall include:

An estimate of the heating and/or cooling energy (MWh/annum) the heat pumps would provide to the development and the percentage of contribution to the site's heat loads to demonstrate how the heat fraction from heat pump technologies has been maximised.

Details of the Seasonal Coefficient of Performance (SCOP) and/or Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER) and how these have been calculated including the expected heat source and heat distribution temperatures (for space heat and hot water) and the distribution loss factor, which shall be calculated based on the above information.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority).

Reason: In order to ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.

Condition : 58 - Dynamic Overheating Assessment

Prior to above ground works in any given phase, a Dynamic Overheating Assessment which follows the CIBSE TM52 methodology for the London Design Summer Year 1 (DSY1) weather file: 2020s, High emission, 50% percentile scenario shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and by the GLA for that phase. The details shall demonstrate that the cooling demand of the systems for the actual building(s) are lower than the notional.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority).

Reason: To minimize overheating risks and in order to ensure the development meets sustainability standards.

Condition : 59 - Power Use and Water Use

No development (excluding demolition and enabling works) in any given phase shall take place until a statement setting out how the development will minimise unregulated demands and operational water consumption has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and by the GLA for that phase. The statement shall demonstrate that the development, once fully occupied, shall achieve an annualised PUE of 1.3 as a minimum (i.e. the PUE level shall not exceed 1.3). For WUE levels, the applicant should report on how this has been addressed and what they are seeking to achieve, with an expectation that they will seek to achieve best practice.

The development shall only be carried out in accordance with the agreed statement (or any variation approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority).

Reason: In order to ensure that the development makes the fullest contribution to minimising carbon dioxide emissions.
